Definition.WordDefinition: Westward sea-ward, i.e., toward the Mediterranean (Deut. 3:27).

Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition:
Westward \West"ward\, Westwards \West"wards\, adv. [AS. westweard. See {West}, and {-ward}. ] Toward the west; as, to ride or sail westward. [1913 Webster]
Westward the course of empire takes its way. --Berkeley. [1913 Webster]

Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition:
Westward \West"ward\, a. Lying toward the west. [1913 Webster]
Yond same star that's westward from the pole. --Shak. [1913 Webster]

Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition: Westward \West"ward\, n. The western region or countries; the west. [1913 Webster]
westward adj : moving toward the west; "westbound pioneers" [syn: {westbound}, {westerly}] adv : toward the west; "they traveled westward toward the setting sun" [syn: {westwards}]
